content: I really like the tracking issue you wrote @mw! Nice work
(On a side note, I seem to have recently lost the ability to assign myself, edit issues, and tag issues on GH)
glad you like it
still some work to be done regarding the implementation
i.e. the sub-tracking issue for lib_measure_me

... lib_measure_me

that's what that Latin name turned into in my head
might be a good name ;)

(On a side note, I seem to have recently lost the ability to assign myself, edit issues, and tag issues on GH)

same for me, in a different WG, I mentioned it to @Pietro Albini

(On a side note, I seem to have recently lost the ability to assign myself, edit issues, and tag issues on GH)

this is probably my fault. I changed some working groups to "read"
I meant to mention that
I will add you + @lqd to "rust-push", which gives you those privileges
in general I think the plan is to make the "working group" membership be read-only
and to give our write-only stuff a bit more selectively

in general I think the plan is to make the "working group" membership be read-only

oh ok then it's fine nbd, we can still be assigned by other people
@lqd I gave you the ability to "write" again -- I added you to rust-push
which is a separate group that has write access ;)
(could you add me as well? I've also lost my ability to assign myself - it's odd being able to approve PRs but not assign issues :stuck_out_tongue:)

@nikomatsakis yeah I saw thanks :) but as I mentioned, probably better to go with your initial plan and deal with it "globally" ? I was hoping we'd maybe talk about it at tonight's meeting, the situation will be the same for everyone on our WG, eg @davidtwco et all as well
GitHub permissions for contributors, working group members and journeypeople is probably a decent topic for #t-compiler/wg-meta but there's certainly going to be overlap with infra.
supossedly there's a triagebot coming soon to assign, add labels, etc without needing the write access

nikomatsakis yeah I saw thanks :) but as I mentioned, probably better to go with your initial plan and deal with it "globally" ? I was hoping we'd maybe talk about it at tonight's meeting, the situation will be the same for everyone on our WG, eg davidtwco et all as well

actually i'm not sure I agree. I think it might make sense to have a "blanket" group that anybody can get on (read perms) and then a narrower group where we add people more selectively
but anyway we're way off topic
should move conversation elsewhere
